definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: Huckabee is competing for the Republican presidential nomination.
sentences.chinese: 赫卡比是共和黨總統提名人的參選人。

sentences.english: What makes candidates appear competent also seems to transcend cultural boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 什麼使參選人看起來更加勝任也超越文化邊界。

sentences.english: Two hundred and ninety-six candidates began the task of running for senator.
sentences.chinese: 296名參議院參選人開始了競選活動。

sentences.english: Fadhila Hanoosh Khalif is an unlikely candidate for public office.
sentences.chinese: Khalif是一個不太可能成功的公職參選人。

definition: to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
